docs.abstract: A lonely high school student discovers she may be a divine messenger in Paul Gordon’s half-baked new Off Broadway musical.
docs.snippet: A lonely high school student discovers she may be a divine messenger in Paul Gordon’s half-baked new Off Broadway musical.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Do you like Kierkegaard?” As flirtatious chit-chat goes, this one sets 17-year-old Heather (Brittany Nicole Williams) apart. You can also see why the jock she’s asking (Carlos Alcala) just walks away. Sadly, this is par for the course for Heather, a pescatarian brainiac who is ostracized by classmates at her Ohio high school for being a “freak,” and quietly stifled at home by a loving but clueless widowed mother (Lauren Elder).

headline.main: Review: In ‘The Gospel According to Heather,’ the Messiah Has Homeroom

docs.abstract: President Biden said the United States and its NATO allies had “nothing to do with” a rebellion by the Wagner mercenary group in Russia.
docs.snippet: President Biden said the United States and its NATO allies had “nothing to do with” a rebellion by the Wagner mercenary group in Russia.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Biden said the United States and its NATO allies had “nothing to do with” a rebellion by the Wagner mercenary group in Russia.

headline.main: U.S. and Allies ‘Were Not Involved’ in Russia Revolt, Biden Says

docs.abstract: Bernardo Arévalo, a professorial lawmaker, stunned the country’s establishment by advancing to a second round against Sandra Torres, a former first lady.
docs.snippet: Bernardo Arévalo, a professorial lawmaker, stunned the country’s establishment by advancing to a second round against Sandra Torres, a former first lady.
docs.lead_paragraph: A presidential candidate campaigning against corruption and impunity in Guatemala stunned the political establishment on Sunday by securing enough votes to advance to a runoff, setting up a showdown with entrenched elites who have long held power in Central America’s largest country.

headline.main: Anticorruption Candidate’s Strong Showing Upends Guatemala’s Presidential Race

byline.original: By Jody García and Simon Romero

docs.abstract: “Gruesome? Perhaps, but I need something of you with me, and this will have to do.”
docs.snippet: “Gruesome? Perhaps, but I need something of you with me, and this will have to do.”
docs.lead_paragraph: This week’s stunning Modern Love essay is one of the most striking, human and moving essays I’ve had the pleasure of coming across in our ever-growing submission inbox.

docs.abstract: Google’s new $1,800 gadget proves that phones with bendable screens are something people might want. Now they just need to get cheaper.
docs.snippet: Google’s new $1,800 gadget proves that phones with bendable screens are something people might want. Now they just need to get cheaper.
docs.lead_paragraph: When I recently turned on Google’s new Pixel Fold smartphone and unfolded it as if it were a book, it transformed into a miniature tablet, similar to an iPad Mini or an Amazon Fire. Then something unexpected happened.

headline.main: Google Pixel Fold Review: Foldable Phones Are Improving

docs.abstract: Fox’s prime time ratings have consistently been the highest in cable news but have fallen off by roughly one-third since the network took Mr. Carlson off the air.
docs.snippet: Fox’s prime time ratings have consistently been the highest in cable news but have fallen off by roughly one-third since the network took Mr. Carlson off the air.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fox News shook up its prime-time lineup on Monday in the first major reorganization to its most popular programming since the beginning of the Trump administration. The moves include permanently filling the 8 p.m. slot that has been vacant since the network canceled Tucker Carlson’s show in April.

headline.main: Jesse Watters to Fill Tucker Carlson’s Old Slot as Fox Shuffles Prime-Time Lineup

docs.abstract: The election victory was a breakthrough for the Alternative for Germany party: It gained a majority in a district, albeit a tiny one, and will have bureaucratic authority over it.
docs.snippet: The election victory was a breakthrough for the Alternative for Germany party: It gained a majority in a district, albeit a tiny one, and will have bureaucratic authority over it.
docs.lead_paragraph: A candidate for the resurgent far-right party Alternative for Germany has won a district administrator seat, the first time since the party was founded a decade ago that it has captured such a prominent regional post.

headline.main: In a First, Germany’s Far Right Will Take Control of a District

docs.abstract: Readers fear that the judge may be biased and the jury intimidated. Also: The revolt in Russia; migrants and New York’s suburbs; climate education.
docs.snippet: Readers fear that the judge may be biased and the jury intimidated. Also: The revolt in Russia; migrants and New York’s suburbs; climate education.

headline.main: Worrying About the Judge and the Jury for Trump’s Trial

docs.abstract: We are honoring the Top 11 winners of our Student Editorial Contest by publishing their essays. This one is by Megan Ray, age 16.
docs.snippet: We are honoring the Top 11 winners of our Student Editorial Contest by publishing their essays. This one is by Megan Ray, age 16.
docs.lead_paragraph: This essay, by Megan Ray, age 16, from Maynard High School in Maynard, Mass., is one of the Top 11 winners of The Learning Network’s 10th Annual Student Editorial Contest, for which we received 12,592 entries.

headline.main: Why We Should Be Fans of Fan Fiction

docs.abstract: We are honoring the Top 11 winners of our Student Editorial Contest by publishing their essays. This one is by Joshua Martoma, age 17.
